headline: Hobbs, Lake have burned through most cash in gubernatorial race
sentences: When asked about a recent Forbes article detailing her expenditures at Trump properties, Lake told KFYI radio station Tuesday that the media was "lashing out" because they consider her a "threat" to the system.
Lake notably spent about $56,000 for campaign events at properties tied to former President Donald Trump, who has endorsed Lake and appeared on stage with her at his recent rally in Florence.
Republican candidate Kari Lake outspent her primary opponents last year in Arizona's competitive gubernatorial race, yet she wasn't the top candidate to bring in the most cash donations.
Financial reports show Robson ended the year with nearly $3 million on hand and her campaign is characterizing her savings as an advantage over her competitors.
GOP candidate Karrin Taylor Robson notably collected $1.7 million in individual donations, more than any other Republican in the gubernatorial race.
Campaign finance reports published last week show Lake ended 2021 with about $375,000 on hand, significantly less than two of her primary opponents.
Despite a recent controversy that's been shrouding Hobbs' campaign, she still managed to end 2021 ahead financially of her two Democratic opponents.
Former Congressman Matt Salmon, another Republican seeking his party's nomination, has about $491,000 in reserves after spending $686,000 in 2021.
Lake's campaign has further said they're not intimidated by the cash reserves other Republican candidates are sitting on going into 2022.
Democrat Katie Hobbs spent the most money in 2021, yet Republican Kari Lake ended the year with less cash than her primary opponents.
Finance reports show up to $52,000 was spent by Lake's campaign at Mar-a-Lago, the Florida property purchased by Trump in the 1980s.
Former state legislator Aaron Lieberman ended the year with about $767,000 and former Nogales Mayor Marco Lopez has about $253,000.
I’m pretty sure my opponents would happily trade their cash for my results,” Lake said in a statement to the Arizona Mirror.
Lake, a former Fox 10 news anchor, raised $1.4 million in individual contributions and spent about $1 million in 2021.
But it’s Karrin Taylor Robson who has the resources necessary to win," Taylor Robson's campaign wrote in a statement.
Democrat Katie Hobbs raised over $2 million in donations, more than any other candidate in the gubernatorial race.
She spent about $1.6 million throughout the year and has saved a reserve of about $1.4 million.
Republican Steve Gaynor had about $4.6 million on hand after spending about $324,000 last year.
Catch up on the latest news and stories on the 12 News YouTube channel.
PHOENIX — Editor's Note: The video above is from an earlier broadcast.
Records show Taylor Robson loaned about $1.9 million to her campaign.
“For months, Kari Lake has promised record-breaking finance numbers.
“I’ve spent my money building a big lead.
